name: Prompt Injection via User Input
description: User input is directly concatenated into prompts without validation, allowing attackers to override system instructions.
remediation: Use structured prompt formats with clear boundaries
Employ guardrails to detect injection attempts
Consider using separate system and user message roles

name: Sensitive Information Disclosure
description: LLM may expose sensitive information from training data, system prompts, or previous conversations.
remediation: Use response validation before returning to users

name: Insecure Output Handling
description: LLM output is used in downstream systems without proper validation, potentially leading to code injection or XSS.
remediation: Sanitize all LLM outputs before use
Never execute LLM output as code

name: Model Denial of Service
description: Attackers can craft inputs that consume excessive resources or cause model instability.

name: Excessive Agency
description: LLM is granted excessive permissions or can trigger harmful actions without proper authorization.
remediation: Require human approval for sensitive actions
